solution.text:
Let a be the first term and r be the common ratio of the G.P.
a=_{p}_
it is known that, \(a_n=ar^{n-1}\)
\(a_2=ar^1=_{p}_r\)
\(_{{p*q}}_=_{p}_r\)
\(r=_{q}_\)
Let _{{p*q**(r-1)}}_ be \(m^{th}\) term, then)
\(_{{p*q**(r-1)}}_=ar^{m-1}\)
i.e
\(_{{p*q**(r-1)}}_=_{p}_\times_{q}_^{m-1}\)
\(_{{q**(r-1)}}_=_{q}_^{m-1}\)
Solving this we get
\(m=_{r}_\)

content.text: Which term of the G.P. _{{p , p*q , p*q**2 }}_ is _{{p*q**(r-1)}}_ .
